adjective.description: Conceited, self-important, pompous; opinionated; dogmatic, unbending.
Of, relating to, or dealing with practice, practicalities, or fact, as opposed to theory, speculation, or ideals; practical, realistic.
Linguistics. Of or relating to pragmatics.

origin: Mid 16th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin pragmaticus + -al; compare -ical. With use as adjective compare later pragmatic.
